intro: Hieracium variodens, commonly known as the variable hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers range in color from yellow to orange. Hieracium variodens is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of environmental conditions, making it a common sight in temperate regions.
